alert.note: Alert for Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 04 at 3:11PM EST until January 04 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Nassau County in northeastern Florida... Bradford County in northern Florida... Southern Baker County in northeastern Florida... Central Union County in northern Florida... Northwestern Clay County in northeastern Florida... Southwestern Duval County in northeastern Florida... Southeastern Charlton County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 400 PM EST. * At 310 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lake Butler, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. Possible tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Starke, Lake Butler, Callahan, Raiford, Middleburg, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Maxville, St. George and Beasley. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for northern and northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for northern and northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.
